reviews.text: The entrance is free and once inside you can the old walls and through a glass panel in the floor the old foundations

Barcelona is a city that although modern and forward thinking has an absolutely fantastic history and this is reflected in its amazing architecture and lots of sites that if you look carefully at are actually Medieval. 
Some of the most famous plaza's in Barcelona have iconic landmark structures   and these were built on top of Roman and Medieval ruins,this is most evident in Plaça Del Rei ( Kings Square  ) ,if you look closely at the foundations and walls of Capella Reial De Santa Agata ,Medievil and Roman walls are evident but walking around the city you will come across reminders of the rich history of Barcelona in the ruins of the past.

One thinks of Barcelona as Spain's most modern and most hip European cities.  Well it is but it also boasts a medieval past.  That can be seen both isn't the gothic quarter.  But it is most striking that in an area of skyscrapers and modern buildings and shops you can still see pieces of the 14th century and earlier walls that used to ring this city.
